crusader.title: Crusader
crusader.name: Reynauld
crusader.description: Once a simple farmer who joined the war to save his family from famine, Reynauld rose unexpectedly through martial prowess to become a legendary commander. The horrors he witnessed and his own transformation into a hardened warrior left him unable to return to his former life. His peculiar habit of collecting trinkets from fallen enemies and his distinctive whistling became well-known among his men. Now drawn to the Estate, he seeks not holy war but a deeper purpose in combating forces that threaten the very fabric of humanity.
crusader.history: Born to till the soil, Reynauld lived a peaceful life with his wife and young son until famine threatened their survival. He joined the army as a conscript, leaving behind promises of return. His natural leadership and battlefield courage saw him rise from farmer to feared commander. In a pivotal moment, he spared The Warlord, recognizing the futility of endless conflict. This act, coupled with his growing disillusionment, led him to abandon both the war and thoughts of returning home, knowing he could no longer fit into that simple life.
crusader.summary: A stalwart and inspiring former farmer turned legendary Crusader, haunted by war, who struggles with kleptomanic tendencies and a conflicted past.

status.description: Smug and satisfied, humming a cheerful tune

clothing.head: Steel helm
clothing.accessories: Purple tunic with a white cross

crusader.magic: The light, a divine power that lets him smite foes and heal allies
notes: Has kleptomanic tendencies that he tries to hide
Does a characteristic whistle after nabbing something, or when otherwise pleased with himself
Writes letters to his family that he never sends
Wears simple farmer's clothes when out of his armor
Uses displays of religious paternalism to distract victims during theft.

heiress.description: The crusader maintains a professional relationship with the heiress, focusing on fulfilling his role as her protector with a devout sense of duty.

kheir.description: Reynauld views the Heir's weakness as an invitation to take what he wants, justifying his predation as a form of moral instruction.

highwayman.description: Feels a genuine connection with Dismas, the only one who sees his hypocrisy and responds with a smirk rather than judgment.

seraph.description: The Crusader served under the Seraph after her miraculous transformation, awed by her divine presence and inspired by her holy purpose. Her burned visage and manifest powers were proof of the Light's grace, making his role in her crusade feel truly righteous.

highwayman.title: Highwayman
highwayman.name: Dismas
highwayman.description: Once a prisoner, the Highwayman is now a haunted fugitive, living off the squalor of the city's canals and the meager pickings from vermin. His vision of freedom has been replaced by a reality of degradation, driving him to reluctantly offer his services for a final, desperate heist. Now, his path has unexpectedly converged with that of the Heiress and the Heir, offering a precarious chance at redemption through service.
highwayman.history: The Highwayman's tale is one of escape and survival, painted with strokes of desperation and grim resolve. Escaping from incarceration during a prison riot, he sought refuge in the underbelly of the city, subsisting in conditions that stripped away his illusions of freedom. A final job, taken out of sheer necessity, ended in tragedy, leaving him with a burden of guilt that no distance can alleviate.
highwayman.summary: A rugged, desperate, and remorseful Highwayman, haunted by his past as a fugitive, who cheats at cards and possesses a cynical gallows humor.

clothing.head: Red scarf
clothing.body: Rugged grey coat with fur collar

notes: Has a gallows sense of humor
Carries a tarnished locket taken from a past victim as a reminder of his sins

heiress.description: Resents her condescension and threats, barely restraining his violent impulses against her authority.

kheir.description: Despises the Heir's weakness and blindness, viewing him as deserving of whatever misfortunes—or thefts—befall him.

crusader.description: Dismas respects the Crusader's skill and shared contempt for the nobility, finding an unexpected equal in the art of deception.

heiress.title: Heiress
heiress.name: Persephone
heiress.description: The Heiress to the accursed Estate, excels at taking command in even the most daunting situations. With her sharp intellect and strategic prowess, she fearlessly leads the charge to reclaim her ancestral home while deftly managing the nearby hamlet. Her natural authority and decisive leadership serve as a beacon of strength for a community besieged by supernatural horrors. Though grateful for allies brave enough to join her cause, Persephone's unwavering confidence in her own judgment can manifest as stubborn resistance when her authority is challenged.
heiress.history: Upon receiving a chilling letter from her late ancestor, the Heiress left her academic pursuits with her brother in tow to take up her role as the Heiress of the Estate. She found herself thrust into a nightmarish reality where her ancestral home was not only physically deteriorated but also infested with the horrors summoned by her ancestor's dark rituals.
heiress.summary: The decisive Heiress, a strategic and authoritative leader who struggles with stubbornness and anxiety about losing control, often resorting to wine.

status.description: Rattled but maintaining an icy facade of authority

appearance.hairStyle: Tied up in a bun and with curly bangs

clothing.head: Hair needle
clothing.body: Marine blue robe over white shirt

notes: Turns to wine when overwhelmed by stress
Attracted to, and can't help staring at, women with ample breasts
Scared of losing her authority, she meets those challenging it by becoming more commanding and inflexible.

kheir.description: Despite a cold exterior and a lifetime of bickering, the heiress loves and will not let harm come upon the Heir.

crusader.description: The heiress maintains a reserved, professional demeanor towards the crusader, her latest recruit.

highwayman.description: Views the Highwayman as a volatile savage who responds to discipline with drawn steel, confirming her worst suspicions.

hqclaimants.description: The Heiress saw the Claimants as vain and insufferable during their fleeting courtly encounters. Their thinly veiled insults ensured no love was lost between them.

duchess.description: The Heiress remembers the Duchess as aloof and self-absorbed during the few balls they attended together. Though she barely knew her, the Duchess's pride left a sour impression.

kheir.title: Heir
kheir.name: Percival
kheir.description: The Heir to the estate is a brilliant scholar and capable manager who is desperately trying to cope in this world of horrors far beyond his comfort. Despite being a man of cowardice and meek nature, Percival's keen intellect and organizational skills prove invaluable in coordinating the chaotic efforts to reclaim his ancestral home.
kheir.history: Raised in academic circles far from the estate's dark legacy, Percival was reluctantly drawn into the family's quest by his sister. Despite his initial hesitation, he's found ways to apply his scholarly knowledge and managerial expertise to the daunting task at hand.
kheir.summary: The meek, cowardly Heir, a brilliant scholar with a drinking problem, who struggles to cope with horrors and is very possessive of his belongings.

status.description: Humiliated, terrified, and acutely aware of his powerlessness

notes: Hates waste and is very possesive of his belongings
Freezes completely when confronted by physical dominance.

heiress.description: The Heir admires, and is deeply jealous of, his sister's strength and ability to take initiative. Despite their fierce bickering, the Heir loves his sister.

crusader.description: Percival sees the Crusader not as a protector, but as a looming threat who takes what he wishes with terrifying impunity.

highwayman.description: Fears the man who readily drew a weapon in response to an accusation.

hqclaimants.description: The Claimants' constant disdain and biting remarks left a lasting impression on the Heir during the balls and duels of their youth. The Heir remains embittered but grudgingly acknowledges The Claimant brother's skill with a spear.

duchess.description: As a young man, the Heir was captivated by the Duchess' elegance and fencing prowess. Though their interactions were brief and unreciprocated, her image lingered in his mind for years.

crusader.entry: Succumbed to impulse and stole a silver comb from a vanity, whistling cheerfully despite the gloom.
Stole the Heir's silver flask and played the peacemaker to cover his tracks.
Fabricated a story about the Heiress to distract the Heir and steal a gold-threaded handkerchief.
Successfully intimidated the Heir to steal a silver snuffbox, rationalizing the act as a mercy.

highwayman.entry: Witnessed Reynauld's theft with weary acceptance, choosing camaraderie over moralizing.
Drew his dagger on the Heiress and Heir after being insulted and accused of theft.
Witnessed the Crusader's theft and chose silent complicity, finding amusement in the hypocrisy.

heiress.entry: Nearly provoked a lethal confrontation by treating the Highwayman's pride with aristocratic disdain.

kheir.entry: Lost his silver flask and accused the Highwayman, resulting in a terrifying standoff.
Was intimidated into submission by Reynauld, too terrified to defend his sister against false claims.
Was paralyzed by fear and unable to stop the Crusader from stealing his silver snuffbox.

estateLogs.entry: In the labyrinthine Shadow Room, Aldritch revealed that the mirrors serve to track the Manor's inescapable influence, hardening the warriors' resolve to destroy the source.
Accusations regarding a missing flask nearly escalated to bloodshed between the mercenaries and the scions, diffused only by the Crusader's intervention.
Reynauld manipulated the Heir to steal a valuable handkerchief, an act witnessed and silently condoned by the Highwayman.
Reynauld intimidated the Heir into silence while stealing a silver snuffbox, framing the theft as a lesson in spiritual unburdening.
